bwwExcerpt: It’s hard to decide whether to give Jodie Comer a Tony Award or an Olympic Gold Medal (or both) for her emotionally and physically exhausting solo turn in Suzie Miller’s award-winning drama “Prima Facie,” now making its American debut at the Golden Theatre under the excellent direction of Justin Martin. Either way, she delivers the most remarkable performance in a season of exceptional acting work.
showScoreExcerpt:
“She [Jodie Comer] delivers the most remarkable performance in a season of exceptional acting work...Comer’s complete commitment to the role keeps us mostly riveted through the show’s sometimes banal first half, even as we can’t help but suspect that Miller must have more on her mind than justifying criminal defense work.”
